page.title: 18Local History
page.content: Gauldry was originally a gallows village.It was first called "The Gallows".This is a very descriptive name as the site where the gallows were can still be visited.Later the name changed to "Gallows Rode".Rode is spelt this way in most old books.After that the name "Gallows Roa"came into being and then "The Gallery".The final change was to Gauldry,but locally the village is still known as "The Gauldry"by many.You can get to the gallows by this route.From the Post Office,follow the main road to Windmill Road.Down this road to Priory Road,up Priory Road where you will find gallows field.A grim reminder of the past. by Nancy Burn. -------------
